passage:
(1) Temperature changes with elevation in our atmosphere in a phenomenon known as the lapse rate. As one climbs higher up a mountain or travels in an aircraft to higher altitudes, the temperature generally decreases. This relationship between elevation and temperature plays a crucial role in many atmospheric processes and affects climate patterns worldwide.

(2) On average, temperature decreases by about 6.5 degrees Celsius for every 1,000 meters of elevation gain. This occurs because air pressure decreases with height, causing the air to expand and cool. This cooling effect explains why mountain peaks remain snow-covered even in summer months, while valleys at lower elevations experience much warmer conditions.

(3) However, temperature inversions can sometimes disrupt this pattern. An inversion occurs when warm air sits above cooler air, reversing the normal temperature gradient. These inversions often happen in valleys during winter, when cold air flows downhill and becomes trapped beneath warmer air above. People living in valley towns may experience colder temperatures than those residing higher up the slopes.

(4) Elevation affects temperature differently depending on location and season. In tropical regions, the cooling effect of elevation creates distinct climate zones within short distances. This allows for diverse agriculture, where crops that would normally grow in temperate regions can be cultivated at higher elevations near the equator. Many coffee plantations, for example, occupy the middle elevations of tropical mountains where temperatures are ideal.

(5) Understanding the relationship between elevation and temperature has proven important for many fields, from agriculture to urban planning. Mountain communities must budget for heating costs differently than coastal areas, and building designs must account for temperature variations at different elevations. Climate scientists also study this relationship to better predict how global warming might affect different regions based on their topography.

questions.question: Which form of the verb is correct? 'She _____ her homework before her parents arrived.'
Choose the correct comparative form: 'This test is _____ than the previous one.'
Select the correct preposition: 'I'm interested _____ learning new languages.'
Which sentence has the correct word order?

options.A: Yesterday went I to the store.
options.B: Yesterday to the store I went.
options.C: I yesterday went to the store.
options.D: I went to the store yesterday.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'If it _____ tomorrow, we will cancel the picnic.'
Which sentence uses the modal verb correctly?

options.A: You should to visit Paris someday.
options.C: They must be at home now.
options.D: We might to go to the beach tomorrow.

questions.question: Select the correct passive form: 'The book _____ by many students.'
Choose the correct relative pronoun: 'The woman _____ lives next door is a doctor.'
Which sentence correctly uses the past continuous tense?

options.A: I was walk in the park when it started raining.
options.B: She were reading a book last night.
options.D: We were having dinner when the phone rang.

questions.question: Choose the correct article: 'I saw _____ interesting movie last weekend.'
Select the correct verb form: 'She _____ to work every day.'
Which sentence uses the present perfect correctly?

options.A: I have seen that movie last week.
options.B: She has lived here since three years.
options.C: They have never been to Paris.
options.D: We have went to the gym yesterday.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'There _____ many people at the party last night.'
Select the correct conjunction: 'I wanted to go to the concert, _____ I didn't have a ticket.'
Which sentence has the correct subject-verb agreement?

options.D: Each of the students has a computer.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'Despite the rain, they decided _____ with their picnic plans.'
Choose the correct phrasal verb: 'We need to _____ early tomorrow morning.'
Select the appropriate expression: 'That movie was really _____. I couldn't stop laughing!'
Choose the correct collocation: 'She _____ a mistake in her calculations.'

Choose the correct linking word: 'I wanted to go swimming; _____, the pool was closed.'
Select the correct fixed expression: 'The new restaurant is _____ for its excellent pasta dishes.'
Complete the sentence: 'I need to _____ a dentist appointment for next week.'
Choose the correct word form: 'Her _____ of the problem was very insightful.'
Select the appropriate register for a formal email: 'I am writing _____ the job advertised in yesterday's newspaper.'
The mountain _____ extend from north to south through the country.
The old castle now _____ a prominent position overlooking the city.
Recent studies have _____ that regular exercise improves mental health.
We need to carefully plan our _____ for the upcoming vacation.
The small town is located in a picturesque _____ between two mountains.
Riding a _____ to work is both eco-friendly and good exercise.
The treasure was found at the _____ of the ocean.
In older texts, the word '_____ regions' often referred to the underworld.
The large _____ provided a beautiful view of the garden outside.
Next summer, they plan to go on a Caribbean _____.
Due to the severe weather, we were _____ to cancel our outdoor plans.
The movie will _____ be a success with its amazing special effects.
There's a beautiful marble _____ in the entrance hall of the museum.
Can you help me _____ my missing keys?
The farm has extensive wheat _____ that stretch to the horizon.
What is the main topic of the passage?

options.B: The relationship between elevation and temperature

questions.question: According to paragraph 2, temperature generally decreases by approximately how much for every 1,000 meters of elevation gain?
What is a temperature inversion, as described in the passage?

options.B: When warm air sits above cooler air
options.C: When mountains are warmer than valleys
options.D: When air pressure increases with height

questions.question: In paragraph 3, where are temperature inversions said to commonly occur?
According to the passage, why can crops that normally grow in temperate regions be cultivated near the equator?

options.C: Because higher elevations create cooler temperatures

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a field that benefits from understanding the relationship between elevation and temperature?
What example is given in paragraph 4 of a crop that grows well at middle elevations of tropical mountains?
Why do mountain communities need to budget differently for heating costs compared to coastal areas?

options.A: Because mountain communities are generally wealthier
options.B: Because of temperature differences due to elevation
options.C: Because coastal areas use different heating systems
options.D: Because energy costs more in mountainous regions

questions.question: What causes air to cool as elevation increases, according to the passage?
What term is used in the passage to describe the rate at which temperature changes with elevation?
